name: 1.14 "Let Me Count the Ways Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 1 | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Mark King.

	Mark King played Marshall on two episodes of "Cheers". Not a well known actor, he also appeared in "Remington Steele" as Tom Donovan.

questions.text: Who did Marshall say would lose the ball game?
questions.explanation:
Celtics.

	Marshall was a very smart man and found a way to figure out who would win the basketball games. Sam and Coach actually bet against the Celtics because of this information.

her mother.

	Diane's mother was a rich lady. Diane's father died some time ago.

questions.correct: to tell her that her cat died
options: to tell her she's getting married
to tell her she broke up with her boyfriend
to tell her that her dog died
questions.explanation:
to tell her that her cat died.

	Diane was very close to her cat and took the news very hard. The other people in the bar could not understand why she was so upset over a cat.

questions.text: What was the name of Diane's cat?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth Barrett Browning.

	Diane named her cat after a poet. The real Elizabeth Barrett Browning was married to Robert Browning. She is known for poetry books such as "Sonnets from the Portuguese".

questions.text: What did Carla say made a cat different from a goldfish?
questions.explanation:
"you can't flush a cat".

	Diane hoped Carla would be more understanding, having had pets in the past. Carla didn't see the reason someone would be so upset over the loss of a pet.

questions.text: What good did Carla find in a loved one dying?
options: "There is no good. It all just really sucks."
questions.explanation:
"It ain't me."

	Carla told Diane there was something good in everything. When Diane asked her what possible good there was in someone dying, that was her reply. Carla was not a very compassionate woman.

questions.text: What was the name of Coach's grandfather's dog?
questions.explanation:
Bruno.

	Coach said he himself never had a pet but he loved his grandfather's dog. The dog died when he fell down in the bathtub.

questions.text: What did Diane say saved her life when she was a child?
questions.explanation:
her cat.

	She said when she was 12 years old, her parents separated. She thought about killing herself but didn't because she didn't know who would take care of her cat. She said the cat saved her life that night.

No.

	Diane was feeling vulnerable and upset about her cat dying. Sam was consoling her and while they were hugging they almost kissed but Diane stopped it.
